intro: Plumeria berteroi, commonly known as the Hawaiian plumeria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific, including Hawaii, Tahiti, and the Cook Islands. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, fragrant flowers that come in shades of white, yellow, and pink. The plant has simple, opposite, ovate leaves that are usually dark green and glossy. Its woody, branching stems are often used in traditional Hawaiian leis, and it thrives in well-drained soil with ample sunlight. Plumeria berteroi is also known for its ability to produce a milky sap that can be toxic if ingested.
